Factsheet

Developer:
CRAMD
Based in Davis, CA
Release date:
09 June, 2021
Platforms:
PC
Website:
charmychancey.github.io/MazeRush/build/product/index.html
Regular Price:
FREE

Description

You are a screen-addicted student stuck in a maze (Shields Library) studying late at night, and you’ve lost track of the time. Your phone is about to run out of battery, and you need to find an outlet before your phone dies. Eduroam is down again and you have no data. The library lights have gone out already, so the only source of light you have left at your disposal is your phone’s flashlight. You’ll need to manage your power very carefully if you want to escape with your life and find that outlet. Your phone’s flashlight can be made brighter to increase your range of sight, at the expense of lowering your battery faster. If your phone battery dies before you find the outlet, you will be stuck in the library’s labyrinth without any source of light to navigate, thus losing the game.

History

We wanted to make a game that would be relatable for our peers as students at UC Davis, while also blending in the theme of "power down". We brainstormed many ideas, such as having a device run out of battery(hence "power down"), a general puzzle game, a complex dynamic between abilities and resource management, and simple but impactful art and music. We ended up combining all our ideas together to make MazeRush.

Features

  • An artistic interpretation of our very own UC Davis Shields Library!
  • A sweet Mazing Algorithm.
  • Scary music just in case finals week hasn't given you enough goosebumps.
  • Dynamic lighting and music!
